job_title: Blood Donor Phlebotomist in Buffalo, NY
pros: Connecting lives to help others live..
cons: Snow in winter unloading the trucks..

review_title: Horrible job.....they guilty trip u wit the whole save lives talk......
pros: None unless u wanna be burned out and underpaid
cons: Overworked and unpaid.....schedule jumps around like hopscotch....u could work in the city today and in the mountains tomorrow. Training staff is burned out and overwhelmed with new hires and is very voiceful about it......they talk really nice in interview but u find out the truth once u get in the door

job_title: Blood Services in New York, NY
pros: Feeling of being like a team. Gaining and expanding new lessons and talent.
cons: Like every job, not everyone will get along and not everyone will like everyone.
Not always clear what they are looking for

review_title: Incredibly meaningful work hindered by dismissive leadership in Buffalo
job_title: Tissue Recovery Technician in Syracuse, NY
pros: The work is very rewarding and meaningful. You are bettering the lives of others on a daily basis.
cons: The management does not care about the employees that do the work that makes the company what it is.

review_title: A challenge, are you up for it ?
pros: Very different kind of environment. Very difficult to handle. This is a challenging business. Success is anything you want it to be. Being successful could be rewarding at this company. Your talent must be extensive and must be knowledgeable.
cons: Long hours. A lot of responsibility. Not for the weak of heart. Must have strong perseverance. If you don’t truly dedicate your mind to this you job you will not survive (professionally).

job_title: Donor Screening Specialist in Buffalo, NY
cons: Pay is lower, information changing daily

pros: Some of the people you’ll work with at a lower level will be very kind.
cons: They do not pay appropriately for any low-middle level range jobs. It’s very too heavy. HR Is not remotely objective in any of their decisions and will actively create files on you with untrue information. Upper level managers are either unreachable or causing some kind of drama between other employees. No one cares about each other in any regard, and speaking up about poor or unsafe work environments will definitely get you terminated. Generally higher ups are not interested in the life saving message that PR tries so hard to push on everyone, they are strictly interested in money and cutting corners. Far and away one of the worst companies I’ve ever worked for.

review_title: This was by far my worst working experience of my life. Terrible company to work for
pros: Honestly, no pros to working at this job unless you enjoy being overworked and under payed.Long days random schedules
cons: Everything about this job from wear and tear on your car to the wear and tear on your body

job_title: Tissue Recovery Technician in Albany, NY
cons:
Lack of work life balance
Employees that lie and blame each other
Promoting people who haven’t earned it
Withholding resources
Expecting you to do a job you haven’t been fully trained for

job_title: Facilities Assistant II in Buffalo, NY
pros: it's a job, it'll put food on the table
cons: it's a bunch of old class mates, who get the jobs and vendors

review_title: Ultimately working for a greater good
pros: You are giving back to the community and saving lives. Very flexible and accommodating in regards to work/life balance.
Great mission, very team oriented atmosphere, opportunities for growth and development, generous PTO policy.
Great team, and the work was easy to do
cons: Workload can be a bit overwhelming.
